oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Massacre at Fort Mimms
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white engraving entitled Massacre at Fort Mimms, depicting the raid against inhabitants of the fort led by Creek chief William Weatherford in 1813.

The band of Creeks known as the Red Sticks attacked the fort on August 30, 1813 resulting in the deaths or capture of approximately 250 settlers, militia, slaves, and Creeks who were loyal to the Americans.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fort Mims (Ala.);Creek War, 1813-1814;McQueen, Peter
Indians of North America;Campaigns & battles;Massacres
